content:
TITLE: Installing Flowise via npm
DESCRIPTION: Commands to install Flowise globally using npm and start the application. Includes an option to set username and password.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flowiseai/flowise/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm install -g flowise
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npx flowise start
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npx flowise start --FLOWISE_USERNAME=user --FLOWISE_PASSWORD=1234
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Up Flowise for Development
DESCRIPTION: Instructions for developers to set up the Flowise project locally, including installation of dependencies and build commands.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flowiseai/flowise/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
git clone https://github.com/FlowiseAI/Flowise.git
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
cd Flowise
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
pnpm install
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
pnpm build
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
pnpm start
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
pnpm dev
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing PNPM Package Manager
DESCRIPTION: Command to install PNPM globally using npm. Project requires PNPM v9.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flowiseai/flowise/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm i -g pnpm
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Project Dependencies
DESCRIPTION: Command to install all dependencies for all modules in the monorepo using PNPM.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flowiseai/flowise/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
pnpm install
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building Flowise Project
DESCRIPTION: Command to build all modules in the Flowise project.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flowiseai/flowise/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
pnpm build
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting Flowise Application
DESCRIPTION: Command to start the Flowise application in production mode.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flowiseai/flowise/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
pnpm start
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Development Mode
DESCRIPTION: Command to start Flowise in development mode with hot-reload capabilities.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flowiseai/flowise/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
pnpm dev
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Flowise via NPM
DESCRIPTION: Command to globally install Flowise using NPM package manager.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flowiseai/flowise/blob/main/packages/server/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm install -g flowise
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting Flowise Server
DESCRIPTION: Command to start the Flowise application server.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flowiseai/flowise/blob/main/packages/server/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npx flowise start
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Flowise Authentication
DESCRIPTION: Environment variables configuration for enabling authentication in Flowise.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flowiseai/flowise/blob/main/packages/server/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
FLOWISE_USERNAME=user
FLOWISE_PASSWORD=1234
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting Flowise with Custom Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Example of starting Flowise with specific environment variables using NPX.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flowiseai/flowise/blob/main/packages/server/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npx flowise start --PORT=3000 --DEBUG=true
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Flowise Authentication
DESCRIPTION: Example of setting username and password for Flowise authentication in the .env file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flowiseai/flowise/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
FLOWISE_USERNAME=user
FLOWISE_PASSWORD=1234
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building and Running Flowise Docker Image
DESCRIPTION: Commands to build a Docker image for Flowise, run it, and stop the container.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flowiseai/flowise/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
docker build --no-cache -t flowise .
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
docker run -d --name flowise -p 3000:3000 flowise
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
docker stop flowise
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Docker Compose Environment for Flowise Authentication
DESCRIPTION: This YAML snippet shows how to pass authentication credentials to the Flowise Docker container using environment variables in the docker-compose.yml file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flowiseai/flowise/blob/main/docker/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
environment:
    - PORT=${PORT}
    - FLOWISE_USERNAME=${FLOWISE_USERNAME}
    - FLOWISE_PASSWORD=${FLOWISE_PASSWORD}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Environment Variables for Azure OpenAI Chat Model in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: This markdown table defines the environment variables needed for Azure OpenAI Chat Model integration in Flowise. It includes variables for API key, instance name, deployment name, and API version, along with their descriptions and types.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flowiseai/flowise/blob/main/packages/components/nodes/chatmodels/AzureChatOpenAI/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
| Variable                     | Description                                                                                     | Type                                             | Default                             |
| ---------------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------ | ----------------------------------- |
| AZURE_OPENAI_API_KEY    | Default `credential.azureOpenAIApiKey` for Azure OpenAI Model                                            | String                                                                    |            |
| AZURE_OPENAI_API_INSTANCE_NAME    | Default `credential.azureOpenAIApiInstanceName` for Azure OpenAI Model                                            | String                                                                    |            |
| AZURE_OPENAI_API_DEPLOYMENT_NAME    | Default `credential.azureOpenAIApiDeploymentName` for Azure OpenAI Model                                            | String                                                                    |            |
| AZURE_OPENAI_API_VERSION    | Default `credential.azureOpenAIApiVersion` for Azure OpenAI Model                                            | String                                                                    |            |
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Environment Variables for Azure OpenAI Embedding Model in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: This markdown table defines the environment variables needed for Azure OpenAI Embedding Model integration. It includes variables for API key, instance name, embeddings deployment name, and API version.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flowiseai/flowise/blob/main/packages/components/nodes/embeddings/AzureOpenAIEmbedding/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
| Variable                     | Description                                                                                     | Type                                             | Default                             |
| ---------------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------ | ----------------------------------- |
| AZURE_OPENAI_API_KEY    | Default `credential.azureOpenAIApiKey` for Azure OpenAI Model                                            | String                                                                    |            |
| AZURE_OPENAI_API_INSTANCE_NAME    | Default `credential.azureOpenAIApiInstanceName` for Azure OpenAI Model                                            | String                                                                    |            |
| AZURE_OPENAI_API_EMBEDDINGS_DEPLOYMENT_NAME    | Default `credential.azureOpenAIApiDeploymentName` for Azure OpenAI Model                                            | String                                                                    |            |
| AZURE_OPENAI_API_VERSION    | Default `credential.azureOpenAIApiVersion` for Azure OpenAI Model                                            | String                                                                    |            |
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Environment Variables Configuration for Azure OpenAI LLM
DESCRIPTION: Configuration table showing the required environment variables for Azure OpenAI LLM integration. Includes API key, instance name, deployment name, and API version settings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flowiseai/flowise/blob/main/packages/components/nodes/llms/Azure OpenAI/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
| Variable                     | Description                                                                                     | Type                                             | Default                             |
| ---------------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------ | ----------------------------------- |
| AZURE_OPENAI_API_KEY    | Default `credential.azureOpenAIApiKey` for Azure OpenAI LLM                                            | String                                                                    |            |
| AZURE_OPENAI_API_INSTANCE_NAME    | Default `credential.azureOpenAIApiInstanceName` for Azure OpenAI LLM                                            | String                                                                    |            |
| AZURE_OPENAI_API_DEPLOYMENT_NAME    | Default `credential.azureOpenAIApiDeploymentName` for Azure OpenAI LLM                                            | String                                                                    |            |
| AZURE_OPENAI_API_VERSION    | Default `credential.azureOpenAIApiVersion` for Azure OpenAI LLM                                            | String                                                                    |            |
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Environment Variables for Postgres Vector Store in Flowise
DESCRIPTION: A markdown table listing the environment variables used to configure the Postgres Vector Store integration in Flowise. It includes variables for host, port, user, password, database, table name, content column name, and SSL settings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flowiseai/flowise/blob/main/packages/components/nodes/vectorstores/Postgres/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
| Variable                                 | Description                                           | Type    | Default     |
| ---------------------------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------- | ------- | ----------- |
| POSTGRES_VECTORSTORE_HOST                | Default `host` for Postgres Vector Store              | String  |             |
| POSTGRES_VECTORSTORE_PORT                | Default `port` for Postgres Vector Store              | Number  | 5432        |
| POSTGRES_VECTORSTORE_USER                | Default `user` for Postgres Vector Store              | String  |             |
| POSTGRES_VECTORSTORE_PASSWORD            | Default `password` for Postgres Vector Store          | String  |             |
| POSTGRES_VECTORSTORE_DATABASE            | Default `database` for Postgres Vector Store          | String  |             |
| POSTGRES_VECTORSTORE_TABLE_NAME          | Default `tableName` for Postgres Vector Store         | String  | documents   |
| POSTGRES_VECTORSTORE_CONTENT_COLUMN_NAME | Default `contentColumnName` for Postgres Vector Store | String  | pageContent |
| POSTGRES_VECTORSTORE_SSL                 | Default `ssl` for Postgres Vector Store               | Boolean | false       |
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Environment Variables Table in Markdown
DESCRIPTION: Markdown table defining the environment variables for S3 File Loader configuration, specifically the UNSTRUCTURED_API_URL setting.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flowiseai/flowise/blob/main/packages/components/nodes/documentloaders/S3File/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
| Variable                     | Description                                                                                     | Type                                             | Default                             |
| ---------------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------ | ----------------------------------- |
| UNSTRUCTURED_API_URL | Default `unstructuredApiUrl` for S3 File Loader                                            | String                                                                    |  http://localhost:8000/general/v0/general          |
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Flowise Components via NPM
DESCRIPTION: Command to install the flowise-components package using NPM package manager
SOURCE: https://github.com/flowiseai/flowise/blob/main/packages/components/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm i flowise-components
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Flowise UI Package with NPM
DESCRIPTION: Command to install the Flowise UI package using NPM package manager. This installs the React-based frontend user interface component of Flowise.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flowiseai/flowise/blob/main/packages/ui/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npm i flowise-ui
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting Flowise Server in Shell
DESCRIPTION: Commands to navigate to the Flowise directory and start the Flowise server.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flowiseai/flowise/blob/main/packages/api-documentation/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
cd Flowise
pnpm start
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting API Documentation Server in Shell
DESCRIPTION: Commands to navigate to the API documentation directory and start the documentation server.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flowiseai/flowise/blob/main/packages/api-documentation/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
cd packages/api-documentation
pnpm start
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Flowise in Development Mode using Shell
DESCRIPTION: Command to start Flowise in development mode, which includes the API documentation server.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flowiseai/flowise/blob/main/packages/api-documentation/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
cd Flowise
pnpm dev
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting up Main Server Environment Variables for Flowise
DESCRIPTION: This snippet instructs users to configure the necessary environment variables for queue configuration in the main Flowise server setup.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flowiseai/flowise/blob/main/docker/worker/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
1. Follow [setup guide](https://github.com/FlowiseAI/Flowise/blob/main/docker/README.md)
2. In the `.env.example`, setup all the necessary env variables for `QUEUE CONFIGURATION`
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting up Flowise Worker with Docker Compose
DESCRIPTION: This snippet provides instructions for setting up a Flowise worker instance using Docker Compose. It includes steps for configuring the environment, starting the container, accessing the worker interface, and stopping the container.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flowiseai/flowise/blob/main/docker/worker/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
1. Copy paste the same `.env` file used to setup main server. Change the `PORT` to other available port numbers. Ex: 5566
2. `docker compose up -d`
3. Open [http://localhost:5566](http://localhost:5566)
4. You can bring the worker container down by `docker compose stop`
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Flowise Chat Completions API Endpoint
DESCRIPTION: The endpoint path for accessing the Flowise chat completions API. This endpoint is used to send requests for AI-powered chat completions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flowiseai/flowise/blob/main/packages/components/nodes/chatmodels/ChatNemoGuardrails/readme.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
/v1/chat/completions
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Example JSON Request Body for Flowise Chat API
DESCRIPTION: A sample JSON request body for the chat completions API. It includes the 'config_id' parameter set to 'bedrock' and a messages array containing a user message to initiate the conversation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flowiseai/flowise/blob/main/packages/components/nodes/chatmodels/ChatNemoGuardrails/readme.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
    "config_id": "bedrock",
    "messages": [
        {
            "role": "user",
            "content": "Hello! What can you do for me?"
        }
    ]
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Navigating to Flowise Directory
DESCRIPTION: Command to change directory into the Flowise project folder after cloning.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flowiseai/flowise/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
cd Flowise
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Flowise with Custom Environment Variables using NPX
DESCRIPTION: This command demonstrates how to start Flowise using npx while specifying custom environment variables for port and debug mode.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flowiseai/flowise/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#2025-04-22_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
npx flowise start --PORT=3000 --DEBUG=true
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Up Cypress Testing Environment
DESCRIPTION: Commands for installing and running Cypress e2e tests for Flowise.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flowiseai/flowise/blob/main/packages/server/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
cd Flowise/packages/server
pnpm install
./node_modules/.bin/cypress install
pnpm build
#Only for writting new tests on local dev -> pnpm run cypress:open
pnpm run e2e
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Grafana Dashboard JSON for Node.js Metrics
DESCRIPTION: Defines a complete Grafana dashboard configuration with multiple panels for monitoring Node.js metrics through Prometheus. Includes panels for CPU usage, event loop lag, Node.js version tracking, and process restart monitoring.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flowiseai/flowise/blob/main/metrics/grafana/grafana.dashboard.server.json.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "annotations": {
    "list": [
      {
        "builtIn": 1,
        "datasource": {
          "type": "datasource",
          "uid": "grafana"
        },
        "enable": true,
        "hide": true,
        "iconColor": "rgba(0, 211, 255, 1)",
        "name": "Annotations & Alerts",
        "type": "dashboard"
      }
    ]
  },
  "description": "node.js prometheus client basic metrics",
  "editable": true,
  "fiscalYearStartMonth": 0,
  "gnetId": 11159,
  "graphTooltip": 0,
  "id": 1,
  "links": [],
  "panels": [...]
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Process Memory Usage Panel in Grafana
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines a time series panel for visualizing process memory usage metrics. It includes queries for process resident memory, Node.js heap size (total and used), and external memory usage.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flowiseai/flowise/blob/main/metrics/grafana/grafana.dashboard.server.json.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: JSON
CODE:
```
{
  "datasource": {
    "type": "prometheus",
    "uid": "cds4j1ybfuhogb"
  },
  "targets": [
    {
      "expr": "process_resident_memory_bytes{instance=~\"$instance\"}",
      "format": "time_series",
      "intervalFactor": 1,
      "legendFormat": "Process Memory - {{instance}}",
      "refId": "A"
    },
    {
      "expr": "nodejs_heap_size_total_bytes{instance=~\"$instance\"}",
      "format": "time_series",
      "intervalFactor": 1,
      "legendFormat": "Heap Total - {{instance}}",
      "refId": "B"
    },
    {
      "expr": "nodejs_heap_size_used_bytes{instance=~\"$instance\"}",
      "format": "time_series",
      "intervalFactor": 1,
      "legendFormat": "Heap Used - {{instance}}",
      "refId": "C"
    },
    {
      "expr": "nodejs_external_memory_bytes{instance=~\"$instance\"}",
      "format": "time_series",
      "intervalFactor": 1,
      "legendFormat": "External Memory - {{instance}}",
      "refId": "D"
    }
  ],
  "title": "Process Memory Usage",
  "type": "timeseries"
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Active Handlers/Requests Panel in Grafana
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines a time series panel for visualizing the total number of active handlers and requests in Node.js. It includes queries for both active handlers and active requests metrics.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flowiseai/flowise/blob/main/metrics/grafana/grafana.dashboard.server.json.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: JSON
CODE:
```
{
  "datasource": {
    "type": "prometheus",
    "uid": "cds4j1ybfuhogb"
  },
  "targets": [
    {
      "expr": "nodejs_active_handles_total{instance=~\"$instance\"}",
      "format": "time_series",
      "intervalFactor": 1,
      "legendFormat": "Active Handler - {{instance}}",
      "refId": "A"
    },
    {
      "expr": "nodejs_active_requests_total{instance=~\"$instance\"}",
      "format": "time_series",
      "intervalFactor": 1,
      "legendFormat": "Active Request - {{instance}}",
      "refId": "B"
    }
  ],
  "title": "Active Handlers/Requests Total",
  "type": "timeseries"
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Heap Total Detail Panel in Grafana
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines a time series panel for visualizing detailed heap memory usage in Node.js. It includes a query for the total heap space size, broken down by different memory spaces.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flowiseai/flowise/blob/main/metrics/grafana/grafana.dashboard.server.json.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: JSON
CODE:
```
{
  "datasource": {
    "type": "prometheus",
    "uid": "cds4j1ybfuhogb"
  },
  "targets": [
    {
      "expr": "nodejs_heap_space_size_total_bytes{instance=~\"$instance\"}",
      "format": "time_series",
      "intervalFactor": 1,
      "legendFormat": "Heap Total - {{instance}} - {{space}}",
      "refId": "A"
    }
  ],
  "title": "Heap Total Detail",
  "type": "timeseries"
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Grafana Dashboard JSON Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Complete Grafana dashboard configuration that defines visualization panels for monitoring NodeJS heap memory usage and other server metrics. Includes panel layouts, data source configurations, and display options.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flowiseai/flowise/blob/main/metrics/grafana/grafana.dashboard.server.json.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "schemaVersion": 39,
  "tags": [
    "nodejs"
  ],
  "templating": {
    "list": [
      {
        "current": {
          "selected": false,
          "text": "All",
          "value": "$__all"
        },
        "datasource": {
          "type": "prometheus",
          "uid": "cds4j1ybfuhogb"
        },
        "definition": "label_values(nodejs_version_info, instance)",
        "hide": 0,
        "includeAll": true,
        "label": "instance",
        "multi": true,
        "name": "instance",
        "options": [],
        "query": "label_values(nodejs_version_info, instance)",
        "refresh": 1,
        "regex": "",
        "skipUrlSync": false,
        "sort": 1,
        "tagValuesQuery": "",
        "tagsQuery": "",
        "type": "query",
        "useTags": false
      }
    ]
  },
  "time": {
    "from": "now-1h",
    "to": "now"
  },
  "timepicker": {
    "refresh_intervals": [
      "5s",
      "10s",
      "30s",
      "1m",
      "5m",
      "15m",
      "30m",
      "1h",
      "2h",
      "1d"
    ],
    "time_options": [
      "5m",
      "15m",
      "1h",
      "6h",
      "12h",
      "24h",
      "2d",
      "7d",
      "30d"
    ]
  },
  "timezone": "",
  "title": "FlowiseAI Server",
  "uid": "PTSqcpJWk",
  "version": 5,
  "weekStart": ""
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Grafana Dashboard JSON Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Complete dashboard configuration that defines panels for monitoring application metrics. Includes annotations setup, panel layouts, prometheus queries, and visualization settings for metrics like internal predictions, error rates and throughput.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flowiseai/flowise/blob/main/metrics/grafana/grafana.dashboard.app.json.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "annotations": {
    "list": [
      {
        "builtIn": 1,
        "datasource": {
          "type": "grafana",
          "uid": "-- Grafana --"
        },
        "enable": true,
        "hide": true,
        "iconColor": "rgba(0, 211, 255, 1)",
        "name": "Annotations & Alerts",
        "type": "dashboard"
      },
      {
        "datasource": {
          "type": "prometheus",
          "uid": "cds4j1ybfuhogb"
        },
        "enable": true,
        "expr": "ALERTS",
        "hide": false,
        "iconColor": "rgba(255, 96, 96, 1)",
        "limit": 100,
        "name": "Alerts",
        "showIn": 0,
        "step": "10s",
        "type": "alert"
      }
    ]
  },
  "description": "Application metrics",
  "editable": true,
  "fiscalYearStartMonth": 0,
  "graphTooltip": 0,
  "id": 3,
  "links": [],
  "panels": [...]
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Grafana Dashboard JSON Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Complete Grafana dashboard configuration that defines multiple visualization panels tracking response time metrics. Includes settings for data sources, panel layouts, refresh intervals, and time ranges. Uses Prometheus as the data source and configures timeseries visualizations with specific styling and threshold settings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/flowiseai/flowise/blob/main/metrics/grafana/grafana.dashboard.app.json.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "refresh": "10s",
  "schemaVersion": 39,
  "tags": [],
  "templating": {
    "list": []
  },
  "time": {
    "from": "now-15m",
    "to": "now"
  },
  "timepicker": {
    "refresh_intervals": [
      "5s",
      "10s",
      "30s",
      "1m",
      "5m",
      "15m",
      "30m",
      "1h",
      "2h",
      "1d"
    ],
    "time_options": [
      "5m",
      "15m",
      "1h",
      "6h",
      "12h",
      "24h",
      "2d",
      "7d",
      "30d"
    ]
  },
  "timezone": "browser",
  "title": "FlowiseAI - Custom Metrics",
  "uid": "dds4pojnfec5cc",
  "version": 8,
  "weekStart": ""
}
```
